name: interstitially
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that relates to the space or time between things: The music only appears interstitially between the segments. In these lakes in British Columbia, thick salts form interstitially within lake beds.
More examplesFewer examplesA new approach for enhancing lymph node retention of interstitially injected liposomes is described here.In health care things seem to happen incrementally or interstitially.The mafic minerals occur interstitially between feldspar and sometimes nepheline grains.His claims of ignorance were interstitially placed in the defence of someone who was totally and thoroughly convinced that they were right.
